√bhaj 'divide, share'

present: [1.] bhájati  bhájate etc. V.+   -- [2.] bhakṣi  

perfect: babhā́ja  bhejus etc. V.+  babhakṭha  bhejé  bhejiré etc. V.+  

aorist: [3.] abībhajus   -- [4.] abhākṣīt etc. V.+  abhāk  bhakṣat  ábhakṣi  ábhakta etc. V.+  bhakṣīṣṭa etc.  bhakṣīṣīta  

future: [1.] bhakṣyati  bhakṣyate etc.  abhakṣyan  bhajiṣyati  bhajiṣyate etc. E.+   -- [2.] bhaktā  

verbal: bhaktá V.+  bhaktum B.+  bhajitum  bhaktvā́ AV.+  bhaktvā́ya  -bhajya B.+  -bhā́jam  

secondary: passive: bhajyáte etc. AV.+   -- intensive: bābhaj-   -- desiderative: bibhakṣa-  bhikṣa-   -- causative: bhājayati etc. V.+  bhājayate  bhājyáte etc.  

derivatives: bhāj V.+  bhága V.+  bhajin C.  -bhajya C.  bhajana C.  bhajanīya E.+  bhajenya C.  bhaktí V.+  bhajitavya E.  bhaktṛ RV.  bhāgá V.+  bhāgin B.+  -bhāgya S.  bhāgīyas C.  -bhāja S.  bhājaka C.  bhājin U.+  bhājya C.  bhā́jana B.+  bhājayú RV.  

Compare the derivative root-forms bhakṣ and bhikṣ; compare also √bhañj.
